https://realseafoodcorestaurant.com/our-menu/ann-arbor-menu/ 9/10

Address: 341 S Main St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Casual seafood mainstay for seafood dishes & local produce plus happy hours in the bar.

summary.snippet: "Good food but small portions for price on regular menu."
"I ordered the steamed muscle and crab bucket and the shrimp and scallop risotto."
"A bit pricey, but quality eating and service every time I have visited."

most_relevant.description:
Delicious and tasty seafood found here! Everything was a delight in this restaurant.
We shared an appetizer and a main course between the two of us and enjoyed thoroughly. We tried the crab cake appetizer, which had large enough pieces of crab, it had a great texture to it, and came with a side of salad. As a main, the crab stuffed lobster was amazing and the portion was very large. It has mashed potatoes and grilled vegetables as sides. The flavours were incredible.
Service was impecable.
I highly recommend this place.

There is nothing fresh or tasty in this place. Probably people are writing fake reviews for this place. The half and half steam pots looks like a leftover, and the tomato in the salad taste saggy, the fish is just so so, but whoever made the sauce must hate their job.

This is true fine dining! Very clean professional restaurant. Service was excellent, down to the visit from the GM.
Each dish served was flavorful and cooked to perfection! Seafood was fresh…crab cakes was not made with a bunch of unnecessary fillers, it was sooo delicious! The salmon was really good as well. They mashed potatoes were just as delicious. The crisp of the rice from my appetizer was really good along with the flavor. We even enjoyed the dessert. As soon as we get back to the area this will be our first stop.

Unfortunately, I don’t understand why this place gets so much hype. The food is decent, but in the couple of times we’ve been, someone has been unhappy with their meal. The paella, for example, is underwhelming. It has large chunks of unseasoned, overcooked chicken breast and lacks flavor overall. I got a stuffed salmon that was delicious, but the meal fell flat because it was accompanied by bland steamed vegetables and mashed potatoes. For the price, you can get better seafood elsewhere.

Went on a busy Saturday night during Parents weekend. One of the few places that had no wait.

Food was average. Not overly expensive.

amazing place!! our sever was great and the food was even better . in the summer they close off part of the street and there’s plenty of outdoor seating. it’s so cool to sit out there and see everything going on on the street. i had the sriracha salmon bowl and it was soooo so so good. it sounds silly but even the bread & butter was good lol. i asked  the host where the bathroom was & he so kindly showed me the way. the staff is awesome and so is the food!:)
It is my first time trying here, and why does it look different from the review? 😭😭 I am crying 😭😭I was not expecting this :( I am so sad guys😭😭

We dined at the bar on Sept 6. The female bartender was friendly and pretty efficient. For the price, I am not sure the food lives up. My dining partner left a good portion of the seafood meal behind. The bread was fresh and hot, but we did have to ask for it. The tenderloin steak was under how I ordered, but it was quite tender. The asparagus was hard and not very flavorful. The bar area had a nice crowd for happy hour and the open window/door area is a nice touch. It feels like a nice place with potential to improve.
